thread.title: Ladera Ranch 12-year-old to sing national anthem at Lakers game Monday
thread.title_full: Ladera Ranch 12-year-old to sing national anthem at Lakers game Monday - Press Enterprise

author: IDA MOJADAD
title: Ladera Ranch 12-year-old to sing national anthem at Lakers game Monday
text:
By IDA MOJADAD / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 16, 2015 Updated: 6:39 p.m. Three years after launching her singing career, a 12-year-old Ladera Ranch resident will hit another high note when she performs the national anthem at Monday’s Lakers game.
“They told us, and I got really, really excited,” said Ava Domini Oreski, who is known on stage as Ava Domini. “My friends at school were asking a bunch of questions.”
Her mother, Heather Linberg, submitted videos of Ava singing to various sports teams, including the Anaheim Ducks and Los Angeles Clippers, but it was the Lakers who invited her to sing about a month ago.
Since then, the Ladera Ranch Middle School student said she’s been practicing the national anthem regularly on her own and with her vocal coach.
“I hope that it will bump up my career a little bit,” Ava said. “Maybe some people will see it.”
She has sung at the House of Blues on the Sunset Strip three times since she was 9 years old. Ava also performed at the Orange County Fair this year and in 2014 and lent her voice to a “South Park” episode when she was 7 years old.
“She’s still not allowed to watch it because of the content,” Lindberg said.
The 7th-grader said she hopes to create an EP record with a music video soon and to become a well-known singer one day.
Ava described her music as mostly country, but with mild elements of rock and pop. She writes her own songs, but often performs covers at her gigs. Her favorite artists include the Beatles, Taylor Swift and Katy Perry.
Lakers spokeswoman Lisa Estrada said they first received a submission from Ava in 2013, but didn’t pick her until the most recent one. Pregame entertainment varies from choirs, solo singers and band members, Estrada said.
Ava will sing before the Lakers’ 7:30 p.m. preseason game against the Portland Trail Blazers at the Staples Center, though it is unclear whether the performance will be aired on television.
